title: Tried to sign up for newsletter
content:
The Mailchimp portal has errors.

I'll be honest, after a couple runs through I can't be bothered. If they can't get their programming right, it shouldn't be live in the first place. The error was indicated as missing email address, well it was there and I use it to log into Thunderbird.

I did donate. You have a great email client and I have used it since the beginning. Keep up the good work!

Another note. Captcha? What a pain in the rear! I can't see the pictures clearly some times and running through that nonsense is a waste of my time. You have my information already and wasting people's time is not a good choice. Find another way please.

-Chris
creator: bhome1

title: upgraded to ver 115.0.1 & now can't get importexporttool to work!!! can't use it without this tool
content: can i go back to ver 102?? can't seem to find how to do this online importexporttool ng is grey out not avail. on new version i save dozens of emails from thunderbird to my computer for 'eternal' storage in pdf format & remove them from thunderbird but can't find an easy way to do this now if i try to save as they all go to a folder with .eml suffix which i don't want, if i try to print to pdf i have to name ea. file & if i try to save them to jpg i have to say 'ok' to ea. file i tried to do 119 files this morning & gave up, hate upgrades that change such important things
creator: joanlozier

title: Sincronizzazione thunderbird con casella PEC bloccata

creator: polifranc

title: Trying to create new message filter, but pane is too big, can't reach save button.
content:
Hi. I'm having an issue after the most recent update. I'm trying to create a new message filter, but the pane is too big, and I can't reach "save" button.

I'm unable to shrink the pane, because when I do the whole pane just moves down. When I grab the top to move it back into place, it's the same size.

I've tried change system resolution, and autohiding taskbar, but doesn't help.

Any suggestions?

Thanks.
creator: c.w.twitch

title: RSS display behaviour change with version 115
content:
I noticed with the upgrade to Version 115 from 102 that the handling of certain RSS Feeds changed.

I turned on an older computer which was still running version 102, so I was able to do a side by side comparison.

First was that certain feeds had lost their icon. And it did make me wonder why. One screen shot shows the RSS feed index as displayed in the left pane of the application. Old Thunderbird showed the site icons, New does not. 115 on left, 102 on right.

Second was the display of the article content. The other screen-shot shows the content of the feed article. New Thunderbird does not show the page content only a like of text, where-as old Thunderbird showed the page within Thunderbird itself. 115 on left, 102 on right

Considering the behaviour of the same feed and article on two versions on the same day, I can only guess that the processing logic has changed.
creator: compass_drg

title: Thunderbird 115 isn't downloading mail
content:
There are 20 unread messages sitting in the inbox of my protonmail account, and none of them appear anywhere in thunderbird. Prior to upgrading to 115 mail would get downloaded just fine. Now when I click 'get messages' these messages won't download, no matter what I try.

I've rebuilt the index, removed and re-added the account, started in troubleshooting mode, nothing works.
creator: firefox2377

title: Accessing O365 Online archive using Thunderbird client
content:
Hi Support team, 

    I am looking for an option to add a user's online archive mailbox to his Thunderbird client. I tried adding it as a separate account with "/archive/" as the IMAP directory, but that didn't work. Is there any option to get this done? Please help if any.

Thanks in advance, Pramod

title: M365 Shared Mailboxes disappear with 115.* Unified folders view
content:
I have a number of M365 accounts, including a number of "Shared mailboxes"

Yesterday, I migrated from Thunderbird 102.13.1 to 115.0.1 (Supernova), and with the new version, in the Unified Folders view, the Inboxes of the "Shared mailboxes" do not show up. If I switch to All Folders view, the Inboxes are in the correct place under each account.

Please advise as I cannot see the shared mailbox inboxes in Unified view and I cannot roll back to the previous version.
creator: scott.peron

title: thunderbird on windows 11
content:
After downloading an email from my gmail account thunderbird uses 90% of ram and is essentially frozen. Initially after starting Thunderbird is not responding followed by a slow increase in ram usage to about 90% is ibserved. Tried uninstall and install; but not change in behaviour. Any suggestions of how to repair would be welcome.

Thank You,
